arts.ttl: ‘The rules are very handicapping’ - Charlton boss on Peterborough game go-ahead and praise for Tennai Watson
arts.sum: “We’re hoping there are no late, silly call-ups,” said Addicks boss Jones. “The rules are very handicapping, because you can get put on a standby list, which is unfair, and then get called up late.

arts.ttl: Charlton Athletic boss on end-of-season awards night being moved
arts.sum: Then whatever happens, we will celebrate – hopefully a very successful season – at the right time. Nathan Jones has talked about Charlton Athletic’s determination to have “no distractions” in their promotion run-in – with that thinking behind the club changing their end of season award plans.

arts.ttl: Charlton Athletic boss never had any doubts striker would be Valley hit
arts.sum: Nathan Jones talked about Matty Godden proving the doubters wrong after taking his goal haul for the season to 15 in Charlton Athletic’s 2-1 win over Wigan Athletic today. We brought him here to score goals for Charlton Athletic and Matty Godden has given us the return we wanted.”

arts.ttl: Matty Godden’s double proves decisive as Charlton maintain hot streak at home
Ryan kicks off Wigan Athletic tenure on Lowe note following defeat at Charlton Athletic
arts.sum: The Ryan Lowe era at Wigan Athletic kicked-off on a losing note as Charlton Athletic ran out deserved 2-1 winners at the Valley, with only a late rally giving the visitors any hope of stealing something.

arts.ttl: Wigan Athletic: One change in our expected team v Charlton Athletic!
arts.sum: Paul Kendrick runs the rule over the Wigan Athletic squad and predicts the 11 men who interim manager Glenn Whelan will select to start at Charlton Athletic on Saturday.

arts.ttl: Charlton Athletic will stay humble in League One promotion push
arts.sum: “We have to try every game to get three points. Nathan Jones’ side have suffered defeat just twice in their past 19 League One outings and are five points adrift of the automatic promotion spots.

arts.ttl: Chief executive Charlie Methven on Charlton Athletic departure - and Nathan Jones now showing he is a ‘top, top manager’
arts.sum: “It was never originally meant to be the case that I was going to become chief executive of Charlton,” the former Sunderland co-owner told the South London Press. “There are going to be a whole bunch of announcements that come out in the next few weeks, which is stuff we’ve been working on throughout this season and is positive on the commercial side.
